item.title: How to Add Safe Area [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Then search for -

isinWilderness

Then, remove the coordinates that are wild right now that you want to be safe.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Add Safe Area [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:2, topic:266255”]In the ‘isInWilderness’ method, add another:

|| absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####

Into the second ‘if’ statement.[/quote]
I think he wanted to create a safezone, not wildzone.

On Topic -
Search for your nonWild() method in your client class.

Read full topic
item.source: How to Add Safe Area [Delta Source]

item.title: How to Add Safe Area [Delta Source]
item.dc:creator: @k0j0e k0j0e
item.description:
@k0j0e wrote:

where is that ?

lic boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
if (Type == 1) {
if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
&& (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3220 && absX <= 3299 && absY >= 3520 && absY <=3548 || absX >= 3084 && absX <= 3092 && absY >= 3940 && absY <= 3936 || absX >= 2250 && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <=4715 || absX >= 3332 && absX <= 3356 && absY >= 3244 && absY <=3257) {
return true;
}
} else if (Type == 2) {
if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
&& (coordX >= 2942)) [???HERE ???]{
return true;
}

Read full topic
